subject.name: Programming for Problem Solving
subject.description: An introductory course to programming fundamentals focusing on C language, algorithms, and structured problem-solving techniques.
objectives: Understand the fundamentals of computer systems and programming concepts.
Learn to write, compile, and execute simple C programs.
Develop logic-building and problem-solving skills using algorithms and flowcharts.
Gain hands-on experience with functions, recursion, pointers, and file handling.

units.title: Introduction to Programming
topics: Introduction to components of a computer system (disks, memory, processor, operating system, compilers, etc.)
Idea of algorithm: steps to solve logical and numerical problems
Source code, variables (with data types), and memory locations
Syntax and logical errors in compilation, object, and executable code

units.title: Operators, Conditional Branching and Loops
topics: Relational, logical, and bitwise operators with precedence

units.title: Functions, Recursion and Pointers
topics: Recursion as a method of problem solving
Example programs: Factorial, Fibonacci series, Ackermann function
Pointers in self-referential structures, call by reference

units.title: User Defined Data Types and File Handling
topics: Arrays of structures and nested structures
File handling: opening, closing, reading, and writing (text and binary)
Error handling and random access to files

units.title: Basic Algorithms
topics: Sorting algorithms: Bubble, Insertion, and Selection

suggested_books: Programming in ANSI C, 4th Ed, E Balagurusamy, McGraw Hill Education India Pvt. Ltd, ISBN: 978-9339219666
The C Programming Language, 2nd Ed, W. Kernighan and Dennis Ritchie, Pearson Education India, ISBN: 978-9332549449
